isis.stitle: DOUBLE DIAPHRAGM MGM SPRING BRAKE - RECOMMENDED SPRING BRAKE DISARMING PROCEDURE

svcproc.title: RECOMMENDED SPRING BRAKE DISARMING PROCEDURE

warning.para: MGM Double Diaphragm Spring Brake Assemblies must be disarmed before disposal, or forceful release of the spring brake chamber may occur in the future without warning which can cause personal injury or death.

svcproc.para: Once an MGM double diaphragm spring brake assembly has been removed from the vehicle, uncage the spring brake chamber spring when applicable.

step1.para: Place the Double Diaphragm Spring Brake assembly inside a safety chamber ( Figure 24) for disarming. Close the lid on the safety chamber and lock closed. (The service pushrod may need to be cut off for the assembly to fit in the safety chamber.)
While wearing safety glasses, use an acetylene cutting torch and cut a 1/2 inch by 1-1/2-inch segment out of the spring brake chamber wall through one of the openings in the safety chamber.

Once the spring brake chamber spring is exposed, use the acetylene cutting torch to cut the exposed spring in one or more places until the spring brake chamber spring can be moved around inside the safety chamber with a long screwdriver or similar tool.

svcproc.para: To purchase a safety chamber, refer to GROUP 04 - PARKING BRAKES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
A Safety Chamber can be constructed ( Figure 25).
